docs.snippet: The U.S. government is helping Guyana crack down on a massive smuggling operation that ships gold to New York, Miami, Europe and other countries in South America, authorities said Thursday....

headline.main: ‘The Creeping Expansion of Gun Control Laws’: Readers on Obama’s Executive Actions

docs.snippet: Washington Gov. Jay Inslee signed an executive order aimed at curbing gun violence by improving data-sharing among government agencies and starting a new public health campaign on suicide prevention....

headline.main: Washington Governor Takes Action on Guns After Obama Move

docs.snippet: An elite Rhode Island boarding school agreed Thursday to hire a new, independent investigator to look into allegations of sexual abuse made by at least 40 former students covering four decades....

headline.main: Boarding School Agrees to New Investigation of Sex Abuse
headline.print_headline: Boarding School Agrees to New Investigation of Sex Abuse

docs.snippet: In Douglasville, Ga., and other cities, seminars instructing residents to stay alert, and to attack the attacker if necessary, have become increasingly common....
docs.lead_paragraph: In Douglasville, Ga., and other cities, seminars instructing residents to stay alert, and to attack the attacker if necessary, have become increasingly common.
docs.abstract: Douglasville, Ga, Police Dept is offering town residents instruction on how to survive mass-shooting event; class encourages vigilance and outlines run, hide or fight options; mounting local and national gun ownership, along with growing anxiety over these types of shootings, prompted class.

headline.main: Georgia Town Teaches ‘Fight Back’ as Option in Mass Shootings

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting from Denver.
